at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.policy

Class AbstractEventDrivenScalingPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.policy.AbstractScalingPolicy
      • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.policy.AbstractEventDrivenScalingPolicy

  • public abstract class AbstractEventDrivenScalingPolicy
extends AbstractScalingPolicy
    A special type of a AbstractScalingPolicy, which gets triggered not only on cloud object creation and during host teardown checks (like a regular scaling policy), but which can also be triggered by arbitrary events of the EventCorrelationEngine. Such policies allow finely controlled scaling policies, which get triggered directly by the application.

    • Method Detail

      • onEvent

        public abstract void onEvent(IHostPool hostPool,
           Object triggeringValue,
           long timestamp)
        This method gets triggered whenever the scaling policy receives an event that it is registered for. For this to work, the scaling policy needs to be registered at the IMetricsDatabase implementation managed by the EventCorrelationEngine.
        Parameters:
        hostPool - The current state of the virtual host pool. Scaling policies are allowed to change this, i.e., start new hosts, terminate hosts, or initiate cloud object migration
        triggeringValue - The monitoring value that triggered that event-driven scaling policy
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received monitoring value
